sentence.Network_en: The spokesman confirmed that the area was now in rebel hands.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位发言人证实该地区现已落入叛乱分子手中。

sentence.Network_en: If Douglas came down hard enough on him, Dale would rebel.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果道格拉斯对戴尔太过严厉，他就会反抗。

sentence.Network_en: The rebel forces simply bypassed Zwedru on their way further south.
sentence.Network_cn: 叛军在向南部挺进时直接绕过了绥德鲁。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French rebelle (noun), rebeller (verb), from Latin rebellis (used originally with reference to a fresh declaration of war by the defeated), based on bellum 'war'

entry.def: Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there.

example.tran: 叛军和政府军之间的战争

entry.tran: （政党内部的）持不同政见者，反对派
entry.def: Politicians who oppose some of their own party's policies can be referred to as rebels.

example.ex: The rebels want another 1% cut in interest rates.
example.tran: 反对派希望利率再降一个百分点。
持不同政见的国会议员

entry.def: If politicians rebel against one of their own party's policies, they show that they oppose it.

example.ex: More than forty Conservative MPs rebelled against the government and voted against the bill.
example.tran: 40多个保守党议员反对政府的主张，对法案投了反对票。

example.ex: ...MPs planning to rebel over the proposed welfare cuts...
example.tran: 打算反对削减社会福利提议的国会议员

entry.tran: 叛逆者;不循规蹈矩的人
entry.def: You can say that someone is a rebel if you think that they behave differently from other people and have rejected the values of society or of their parents.

example.ex: She had been a rebel at school.
example.tran: 她在学校时就是个叛逆者。

entry.def: When someone rebels, they start to behave differently from other people and reject the values of society or of their parents.

example.ex: The child who rebels is unlikely to be overlooked...
example.tran: 叛逆的孩子不太容易被忽视。

example.ex: I was very young and rebelling against everything.
example.tran: 我当时非常年轻，对一切都表现出叛逆。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who takes part in an armed rebellion against the constituted authority (especially in the hope of improving conditions)
2. someone who exhibits great independence in thought and action
1. take part in a rebellion; renounce a former allegiance
1. used by northerners of Confederate soldiers;
2. participating in organized resistance to a constituted government;

auth_sentence.content: In defeat, rebel discipline collapsed in some places.
auth_sentence.res_content: In defeat, rebel discipline collapsed in some places.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In defeat, rebel discipline collapsed in some places.

auth_sentence.content: Until they become conscious, they will never rebel.
auth_sentence.res_content: Until they become conscious, they will never rebel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Until they become conscious, they will never rebel.

auth_sentence.content: There was no government confirmation of the rebel claim.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was no government confirmation of the rebel claim.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was no government confirmation of the rebel claim.

stems_affixes.word_buile: belli=bell战争,打斗+ger带来+ent……的→带来战争→交战的
bell战争,打斗+ic+ism具备某种性质→战争的状态→好战性
bellicose[adj.好战的,好斗的]+ity性质→n.好战, 好打架
re反+bell打+ion动作或状态→反打→反叛

stems_affixes.value_cn: 吼叫,怒吼;大声发出,大声喝道

Sentence.sentence: In Japan young women may be rebelling against their mothers' isolated lives of child rearing.
But the movie that really made him famous was his second one, Rebel Without a Cause, that was about teenagers who felt like they didn't fit into society.

means.word_mean: 反政府的人; 反叛者; 造反者

sentences.en: Few people knew exactly what the rebels planned to do.
sentences.cn: 没有人知道叛军究竟打算做什么。

sentences.en: All the rebels have been captured.
The tribes rebelled against the government.

jushi.english: Such treatment would make anyone rebel.
jushi.chinese: 这种对待方式会使人起来反抗。

jushi.english: The peasants rebelled but were ultimately powerless.
jushi.chinese: 农民们起义,但最终未获政权。
